instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.PBUS_G3H: What is PBUS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PBUS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> with solid green light
threads.message:
hello I need some help. I'm stuck and need some guidance. I got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with fainted green light at MagSafe. It had a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. I was able to relieve the short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> by removing <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Now I have solid green light but I still have a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>. Please note that I still haven't switched <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. I tried to inject some voltage but I wasn't able to find a component that gets hot. Any suggestions?

Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> with solid green light
threads.message: Remove F7040 and check in which side es the short pin 1 or pin2....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> with solid green light
threads.message: I removed F7040 but i still had a short on both pads. I figured the short was on the system side of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. I injected some voltage into this pad and found a bad mosfet <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR>. After replacing this and <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> i have a working macbook. Please mark this as solved. Thanks!
